data.title: Anticipating Hazardous Weather and Community Risk Flashcards
data.meta_description: Study with Quizlet and memorize flashcards containing terms like Tornadoes are small, short-lived storms formed on the:, The Forecast product you read on August 30 mentions that a cold front with instability along frontal boundary will be moving through your locality in northern Iowa. The weather event you are likely to be most concerned about during this frontal passage is:, Condensation is a process that can lead to precipitation, flooding, and storm development. Condensation can occur and begin providing the fuel for severe weather when: and more.
data.text:
The Forecast product you read on August 30 mentions that a cold front with instability along frontal boundary will be moving through your locality in northern Iowa. The weather event you are likely to be most concerned about during this frontal passage is:

Condensation is a process that can lead to precipitation, flooding, and storm development. Condensation can occur and begin providing the fuel for severe weather when:

During a rain event, you observe heavy, wind-driven rain for 30 minutes. The dispatch center has received calls about small stream flooding on the southern edge of your community. You report this flooding to the Weather Forecast Office. They will use the information to:

The Forecast Discussion says "A WEAK PRESSURE GRADIENT IS EXPECTED TO PERSIST, KEEPING RAIN OVER THE AREA FOR SEVERAL DAYS." From a preparedness point of view, this phrase suggests that:

Methods for receiving the most recent hazardous weather information and current updates directly from your local Weather Forecast Office (WFO) include all EXCEPT which of the following?
